content: No. Trump won because the Democratic party tried and succeeded in creating a division. It’s because people can’t opt out of voting for a woman unless they like the label of misogynists. It’s because you can only talk about Islam if you agree that it’s the religion of peace (whatever that even means). It’s because people are tired of social justice groups like BLM and feminism who successfully weave narratives that actively harm the demographic they pretend to give a damn about. The list goes on, of course. Trump could have promised the people he’ll build a tower that shoots lasers and sends subliminal messages to the minds of citizens — and people would have voted for him still. Not because they believe in his ideas, but because they can’t stand you. I doubt you’ll get the idea, of course, as you’re too busy finding new dragons to slay — “fake news” is an old concept that was followed by “THE RUSSIANS ARE COMMING!!!!1!” and were still seeing new conspiracy theories popping up. At this point, I’m hoping that it’s at least imaginative and entertaining — I wholly support the conspiracy of Trump making a pact with demons who ride on silver dragons.
